title.value: A comparison of RL-based and PID controllers for 6-DOF swimming robots: hybrid underwater object tracking
title.justification: This title adequately reflects the main focus and scope of the research conducted.
title.quote: A comparison of RL-based and PID controllers for 6-DOF swimming robots: hybrid underwater object tracking

extractions.description: The paper investigates the feasibility and effectiveness of employing a centralized deep Q-network (DQN) controller as an alternative to PID controllers for a 6DOF swimming robot, focusing specifically on underwater object tracking tasks.

type.justification: The study involves experimental evaluations and implementations to validate the proposed methods and algorithms.
type.quote: Our experiments, conducted within a Unity-based simulator, validate the effectiveness of a centralized RL agent over separated PID controllers, showcasing the applicability of our framework for training the underwater RL agent and improved performance compared to traditional control methods.

primary_research_field.justification: The study involves deep reinforcement learning techniques, specifically employing deep Q-networks (DQN) for controlling a underwater robot.
primary_research_field.quote: We present an exploration and assessment of employing a centralized deep Q-network (DQN) controller as a substitute for the prevalent use of PID controllers in the context of 6DOF swimming robots.

sub_research_fields.justification: The focus is on using reinforcement learning (RL) methods, particularly the deep Q-network (DQN), for controlling underwater robots.
sub_research_fields.quote: We employ DQN to minimize the burden of real-world implementation while showcasing the practical applications of RL-based controllers.

name.justification: The model is the primary focus of the paper and is proposed as a central controller for the underwater robot.
name.quote: we present an exploration and assessment of employing a centralized deep Q-network (DQN) controller as a substitute for the prevalent use of PID controllers in the context of 6DOF swimming robots.

caracteristics.justification: DQN is a type of reinforcement learning algorithm that is central to the study.
caracteristics.quote: We employ DQN to minimize the burden of real-world implementation while showcasing the practical applications of RL-based controllers.

name.justification: YOLOv7 is used for object detection in the vision module.
name.quote: We have adopted the methodology outlined in [5], using YOLOv7 for object detection.

caracteristics.justification: YOLOv7 is an object detection model used for detecting underwater objects.
caracteristics.quote: We have adopted the methodology outlined in [5], using YOLOv7 for object detection.

name.justification: SORT is used in conjunction with YOLOv7 for object tracking.
name.quote: using YOLOv7 for object detection, and then employing SORT [48] for detection matching and implementing tracking-by-detection.

caracteristics.justification: SORT is a tracking algorithm used to enhance object detection capabilities.
caracteristics.quote: employing SORT [48] for detection matching and implementing tracking-by-detection.
